ref_item.label: Reinforcement Learning Intervention Arm
ref_item.description: Up to daily, tailored text messages.

pred_item.label: Intervention Arm
pred_item.description: Patients receive electronic pill bottles and up to daily text messages individually adapted using a reinforcement learning prediction algorithm based on daily adherence measurements.

ref_item.label: Control Arm
ref_item.description: Up to daily, untailored text messages.

pred_item.label: Control Arm
pred_item.description: Patients receive electronic pill bottles and standard administrative text messages (introductory, synchronization reminders, and end of study) but do not receive the reinforcement learning text messaging programme.

ref_item.name: Reinforcement Learning
ref_item.description: Participants in the intervention arm will receive up to daily, tailored text messages based on their electronic pill bottle-measured adherence. Given the participants' baseline characteristics and time-varying responses to the messages, a reinforcement learning algorithm will deliver different text messages and adapt over time to determine which type of messaging works best for each individual participant.

pred_item.name: Reinforcement learning-based text messaging programme
pred_item.description: A programme that personalises daily text message outreach using a reinforcement learning algorithm. Messages are tailored based on five factors: framing (neutral, positive, negative), observed feedback, social reinforcement, nature of content, and reflection.

ref_item.description: Medication adherence to type 2 diabetes oral medications (averaged) as measured by the number of dates and times of pillbottle openings in the electronic pill bottles

pred_item.description: Medication adherence measured by averaging daily adherence (calculated by dividing the number of times a patient opened the electronic pill bottle by the number of doses prescribed) for each medication across each patient. Adherence values range from 0 to 1.
pred_item.timeFrame: From the day after randomization until 183 days after randomization (6 months)

ref_item.description: Change in glycated hemoglobin A1c from baseline to end of the 6-month follow-up

pred_item.description: Measured by glycated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) levels collected from routine measurements recorded in the electronic health record (EHR) system.
